I mainly have two problems with Small Plates. 1.) The service is spotty. 2.) The food can be ehh.      Let's start with number one. The last few times I've dined at Small Plates, the service was hit or miss. One night out the service was great- servers paying attention, no hovering, (I can't stand hovering) etc etc. However,  the next time, the service was horrible. I think it's a bit ridiculous if I have to ask four times for a water. Just sayin'.      Issue number two:  The food. Just like the service the food is hit or miss. The last time I was at Small Plates I payed $12 for three pieces of stale bread, 2 strawberries, a handful of grapes and two wedges of cheese.  However, the time before that, I ordered their  Roasted Veggie Pizza and the Chop-Chop salad and both were ridiculously delicious.      What do I actually like about Small Plates? The portions are perfect and the location is great. Would I go back? Probably. Just not anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Cyndi J.
Reviews.Content: It was hot, no AC. Food was great and beer was cold. Service was kinda slow but our server was very nice and accommodating. The fries with all dipping options was my fave!! We were kind of all packed in the place. I literally bumped elbows with the table next to me.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan S.
Reviews.Content: This is a cute place in a great location downtown. Great place to go with a date before going to the Opera House, bars/clubs on Woodward, or a Tigers/Wings game. I just wish there were more places like this downtown.

Reviews.Author: Chelsea M.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went there before and after the Wicked musical showing at the DOH across the street and had a good time. Be sure to make reservations ahead of time. If that isn't possible use call ahead because the wait when we were there was well over an hour. The service was ok but the food was delicious. The grapefruit martini I had wasn't the best so I would avoid that but the cheese and mushroom pizza was amazing.   We will be returning soon.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca O.
Reviews.Content: Small Plates is such a fun little place.  they're prices are really reasonable.  the food is phenomenal.  and the service is usually spot on!  i've been in here before a show, after a Tigers game, before boozin' it up on a Saturday night, and we came here with a small group of girls for a pre-dancing bachelorette party dinner.  everytime everything was great.  so get in there, order a bunch of different dishes, and share them amoung the table.  you can't go wrong!!!

Reviews.Author: Tina B.
Reviews.Content: Very small place.  The servers were very nice and attentive.  I ordered the scallops which came with a small portion of linguine.  The scallops were excellent while the pasta was bland.  Hubby ordered the eggplant sandwich which was really good.  The cheesecake is made on site and was pretty good.  Prices were not bad.  We may go again after the game tomorrow if we don't find anything else to try out.

Reviews.Author: Jason C.
Reviews.Content: Bad awkward service and mediocre food.  Disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Doug C.
Reviews.Content: We went to the Grand Reopening party at Small Plates last week and I have to say that everything I tried was incredible.  The fish tacos were outstanding and one of the larger portions on the menu - 3 full legit tacos with great flavors.  The scallops were melt-in-your-mouth good and the pretzel sliders were great.  I tried a little eggplant/veggie sandwich as well and that was also great.  I'm telling you EVERYTHING was outstanding that I tasted.  As good as all the savory selections were though, I have to say it was the desserts that absolutely blew me away.  The Key Lime Pie was amazing - for me that's a big deal because I'm always sure to get Blonde Giraffe Key Lime Pie when I'm in Miami or Key West and I'm a big fan of real deal legit Key Lime Pie - and this was real deal legit Key Lime Pie.  Also I tried something called butterscotch pots du creme - which I declared a threat to national security it was so good.....  Whatever they've done there, new ownership etc. - it's amazing and I am looking forward to getting back there.  Great decor and atmosphere too!

Reviews.Author: Cherice J.
Reviews.Content: Small Plates is a super narrow place downtown, but it is a nice environment. I just gave a surprise bday party for a friend there a few nights ago, and the customer service was really nice and patient with us...which is kind of rare on a Saturday night. My group pretty much ate everything on the menu. I had the BBQ Chicken Pizza, which was very good. It a good portion. My friends had the BBQ Ribs, Mussels, and Hummus. The prices are conservative, paying roughly $12 for a meal. They have a good wine list too. Because this place is small, I would suggest making reservations for sure!

Reviews.Author: Amy D.
Reviews.Content: We had just finished seeing Chelsea Handler at The Fox theatre, so we were looking for a place to have a night cap.  We walked by Small Plates on the way to our hotel and it looked really nice.  They do have a patio, but it was a little chilly by the time we were there.  We both ordered a martini and they are $9 each.  We tried the SP Cosmo and the lemon drop.  I know people want they moneys worth, but it was like sipping a shot, it tasted like straight alcohol, they needed more cranberry juice or citrus.  Along with the drinks we split a garlic shrimp pizza, it was perfect for sharing.  The shrimp were huge and the crust was nice and crisp.  I would go back for their food, but probably not for the drinks.

Reviews.Author: Duke A.
Reviews.Content: At Small Plates, you get to enjoy and share multiple tapa dishes with your friends. It makes you feel like you are sampling food at an Iron Shef shooting. Great ambience and superb service too.

Reviews.Author: S F.
Reviews.Content: My bf and I received a gift card as a present to try the place.  I was excited to try it as I love to dine this way - tapas/appetizers/small plates - basically a bit of everything. I ordered the crab cakes and was extremely disappointed to get tiny (1/2 dollar sized) portions of shriveled, dry, fishy tasting pucks.  We also ordered the beef tenderloin and this was way overcooked and lacking in flavor.Our fries were served with the "house" ketchup which tasted like sweet barbecue sauce and we were scoffed at when we requested the good ol' REAL trusty condiment.Don't get me wrong, I'm one to plunk down tons of money for a well-cooked meal, and portions size really wasn't the issue here as some other posters have mentioned, but I'd rather eat at a dive bar with superior food than a trendy looking place with mediocre or subpar food.

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: Bad experience for me though it was beautiful and comfortable setting. The Host took a while to greet and seat us. Once seated the waitress was prompt to greet and friendly but immediately became very slow. Sherry mushrooms were good but my petite fillet was ordered medium and delivered rare. Cold in the middle rare. It took ten long minutes for her to follow up. I had cut the steak in 3 pieces. It was returned to me in 3 pieces and was well done. My party was charged for a plate and a drink that never came. It then took an even longer time to get the correct bill. Nothing on the menu was creative. I coul've cooked a better meal myself. Overall it was just a bad experience.

Reviews.Author: Matthew M.
Reviews.Content: Parking was not really an issue...we went on a non Tigers game night. Waitstaff and bartender very friendly....they had plenty of recommendations. Drinks were good. Since we hadn't been in a while we ordered several items. Pretzel burgers were good, fish tacos excellent. Wedge salad needed a little something. Calamari was over salted. Cornbread was good; not the sweet variety. Tried the hot dogs. If you've ever had a real Detroit coney you will be disappointed. Finished up with the bread pudding which was good.All things considered, the atmosphere was good. The drinks were good. The food was good and had a great variety. We will def be back and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Author: Lauren C.
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you something - I used to ignore this place.  It was not good the first time I went there.  But that was in 2009 or something.  They recently renovated and I believe changed some chefs/cooks.  Now, it's GREAT.  I have been there a couple of times in the past 6 months.  Everything I have tried tastes good.  Some things to try: pretzel sliders, calamari, fish tacos, BBQ chicken pizza.  And some customers leave poor reviews because they have unreasonable expectations. Don't forget the model of this place.  It's small plates, people.  I most recently solicited last week, and this was my third stop before I settled on where to eat.  I live in Detroit, and other restaurants were either closed early, or had crap service (DBC...). Small plates was open and happy to serve!  Thanks so much!

Reviews.Author: jerry p.
Reviews.Content: Small Plates was one of the first to start the upswing in Downtown Detroit dining. We have always had the Rattlesnake as far as great modern food, but Detroit needed more cool restaurants. I knew Chef Arron True when he worked at Shiro in Novi (another stellar restaurant)  He was always putting out amazing things from that kitchen.  I think that is why the Panko Shrimp and other Asian influences are so prevalent. I personally like the tenderloin, but there are usually some don't miss specials. Small Plates was just what Detroit needed at the time. A hip but upscale place where you could eat amazing things and hang out -- the bartenders here always make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Author: Robert Z.
Reviews.Content: The food was pretty good...the service was fantastic. The only issue was that the vslue was underwhelming.

Reviews.Author: Erin H.
Reviews.Content: I love the vibe in the place - high end and comfy at the same time.  A great locale in Detroit and perfect when eating with a group of adventurous eaters - always better to do tapas with people who will try everything.  Everything we got here was tops.  Check it out!

Reviews.Author: Jessica M.
Reviews.Content: I came here again with a large party before a show at the Opera House. We were not well prepared and had to wait for all 9 of us to be seated. We almost missed the show.  It was not Small Plate's fault. They had tables set up for another large party seeing the same show. They lingered, enjoying their drinks, causally talking and laughing while the 9 of us stood in their incredibly small host area for about an hour. The bar was packed, as was every tableThe staff of Small Plates made it great for us. They gave us a few small 4 cheese pizzas on the house while we were waiting. They made sure to have our order in before the other party left so we could eat immediately and get into the show. They gave us extra plates, too once we were seated. The manager was doing his absolute best to make sure we were taken care of. The bills were even ready as our food came out so we could eat while the waiter processed our payments. I was extremely impressed at the level of service. I am sure they are aware of the sometimes discriminating crowd before shows at the Opera House. The food was good, although we had to rush rush rush. We ended up in the seats with literally 30 seconds to spare before the show started. Kudos, Small Plates we couldn't have asked for a more on-point example of top-notch service. I will try again and hopefully have great things to say about the food!

Reviews.Author: julie a.
Reviews.Content: Small Plates in downtown Detroit is TER-RI-BLE unless you like bland,poorly prepared food. I heard about this place 3 years ago and made a reservation as soon as I came back to Detroit only to find out there are  new owners that changed everything but the name. Yuck. Last time I tasted food this bad I was in the hospital.  Apparently the "chef" sent all his guys in the kitchen home that saturday night to save money.Guess they took any semblance of flavour with them! The coffee shop next door is 10x better.

Reviews.Author: Kristina A.
Reviews.Content: SOOO good. Pick and choose tapas with friends and everyone can have a little of everything. The location is so great across from the Detroit Opera House so if you go before a show you see some fancy outfits and the place is packed. On an off day it can be completely empty though. Spring rolls, homemade fries and ceasar salad is what I crave. The presentation always feels modern and upscale.

Reviews.Author: Tyra N.
Reviews.Content: My ahi tuna was fresh and tasteful. My drink with bourbon was great too. My date was disappointed with the capresse salad and the Caesar salad which was nothing like the one served by previous owners. The menu was more average American than speciality. They had a lot of regular food with a twist. They tried too hard. No more cheese platter! This disappoints me. The reason I brought my guy here was for the famous Caesar salad that many people could eat but their version with one whole romain heart cut in half, slivers of parmesan, drops of dressing, some sautéed onions and a single anchovy was over the top. Just serve a damn salad. Also it was on a small plate, not a bowl which is awkward for eating lettuce. Their chipotle sauce was lacking too, just mayo and something else added. We were offered no water and had to ask for flat wear. The wait staff congregated to complain at the bar and of course the most annoying was some typical black chick. I'm so over this place. This was my spot for a long time but I'd rather venture to Angelina's for fine dining or the brewery next door for American food. This will be closed... soon.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey C.
Reviews.Content: Other than being right across from the stadiums and the opera house small plates has very little to offer. The service was dismal, and the food was entirely forgettable. My original drink could not be made because they were out of the requisite ingredients which in itself if forgivable but then the one ordered to replace this was not brought until after the food was served. On that note our food for a table of four was brought out at three separate times. I would hate to have someone tell me I had to go back here again.

Reviews.Author: Vidhi B.
Reviews.Content: I took my brother here for a quick dinner before a Friday night Tigers game, having been here for a weekday lunch prior. So disappointed. The hostess was a space cadet - had no idea what was going on. Seated us at the kitchen bar (which was great and we loved it), but made it seem like it was a horrible place to sit. Sat down and waited 10 MINUTES, to be greeted and even then, I had to go to the hostess and tell her we hadn't been greeted. No apology, no nothing. Automatically put a sour taste in my mouth. I get that it was a busy night, but to be fair, there was no wait and it's a block from Comerica, they should be used to busy nights and how to accommodate their customers. The only saving grace was their food which I love. Plates are definitely small (especially their pizzas), but it's quality food. I've been to restaurants with better small plate options with much better service so I'm not sure I would go back.

Reviews.Author: adam J.
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this place since 2005. Usually a couple times a year.  Went recently at the beginning of November. They did not have one dish and one drink (weird?) that we wanted but otherwise a decent meal. We had the Groupon so that was nice. A couple things though.1. They need a new menu. Last updated one that I can remember was at least 3 years ago. Maybe I missed something. A place like this should have a new menu every season! I mean for a place that is on the edge I would think the first thing you would do is save the classics and get some new stuff on the menu!!2. This place has lost an intangible something. The charm isn't there anymore. They have that big paper sign hanging in the window like some Hall Rd. chain restaurant. The staff, while nice and attentive, when we went just lacked that original classic character when I first started going to Small Plates. They too seemed to be imported from a Texas Roadhouse or something. (No offense to those servers there, they work hard, but the servers that used to be at Small Plate's definitely dolled out the feel goods and warm and fuzzys.)This place can comeback to it's original glory but it needs to reinvent itself a bit. Not too high on my recommendation list as I don't think it can blow people away like it used to, but me and my wife will still go if only for sentimental and nostalgia reasons. Plus like I said, the food is still good but it's just different now.

Reviews.Author: Brian A.
Reviews.Content: Our first time here, read some bad reviews,but under new ownership and did not disappoint . Great food,service and atmosphere. Went prior to Tigers game and left full and happy !

Reviews.Author: Craig M.
Reviews.Content: I liked small plates, the food was good as was the wine.  It was a nice place to go after a Tiger game, very casual and no need to be dressed up.  Don't know if I would make it a destination restaurant, but while downtown it's a good place to stop by.

Reviews.Author: Julia Y.
Reviews.Content: MAC! I feel betrayed!! We were with you that night and thought the food was terrible! I ordered the margherita pizza and my partner had the calamari--and if there was any distinguishable feature of either of them, it was the distinct tastelessness of frozen, processed food thrown in a microwave! We also tried the fried green tomatoes and a few other dishes and were not pleased. bottom line: way too expensive for what tastes like TV dinners.

Reviews.Author: Ryan S.
Reviews.Content: Being that it was our first time there, we asked the waiter for recommendations. He coincidentally recommended the two most expensive things on the menu. We ordered a bunch of stuff, and the shrimp was really, really, overcooked - like rubber. We sent it back (I have literally NEVER in my entire life sent food back, it was that bad). It returned later just as overcooked with no apologies or explanations. Service was slow and uninterested as well. Never, ever again. Plus, no draft beer. Fairly small selection of bottled beer.  Other than that, great.

Reviews.Author: C G.
Reviews.Content: We had the Groupon (paid $20 for $40 worth of food), and we were up front about it in the beginning so there were no surprises.  It was Sat night at around 8 pm, and the place was full.  We had good timing and were seated right away because some other tables left.  The service was not good.  At all.  It took several minutes before we were greeted and put in a drink/appetizer order.  Then, the appetizer came out before our drinks, and we had no silverware/napkins.  When our drinks finally came, we told our server that we still had no silverware & when he came back with the next appetizer he STILL had not gotten us silverware.  But, we were in no hurry.  And, the food was good.  We had the Asian lettuce wraps and baguettes with goat cheese.  Both were great.  I would skip the Caesar salad next time (generous portions for the full size-more than 4 people need and some was left) and go for the Maurice.  We got the cut fries and chicken BBQ pizza.  Both were yummy!  When it came time for the bill, the waiter was fine with the Groupon (despite seeing previous reviews below), so don't let that deter you.  But if you come, be prepared for poor service (others were right that it looked like only 2-3 servers in the whole restaurant), and take your time to enjoy it!  The Groupon deal made this experience a real win for us!

Reviews.Author: Laura C.
Reviews.Content: Not my kind of place.  Overly priced and not very fresh, though they claim they are fresh.  Just not good.

Reviews.Author: Kristen M.
Reviews.Content: Over the past 8 years or so I have been to Small Plates about 5 times and pretty good. Went there a few weeks back before the opera--disappointing. I ordered portabella mushroom and zucchini sliders they were bland and the buns really really big and cold.  The ceasar salad was good. Our check for 2 people was $65 and we were not very satisfied. Also, we were sitting at the pizza bar in back and the pizza cook told us it was his first night working there and didn't look like he had any idea what he was doing.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: Dissapointingly dumbed down menu - from when they first opened. Friendly but generally below average service. Over-priced for what you get. Really wanted to like it - want to support downtown restaurants but sorry to say, we won't be back. Will stop reccomending it to friends.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie R.
Reviews.Content: Food was amazing! Service great! 1st time experiencing tapas style and I'd come here again for sure!!!!

Reviews.Author: Caryn W.
Reviews.Content: I went to Small Plates last night in a group of 9 before seeing a show at The Detroit Opera House. I had never been there and didn't really know what to expect. We had a few questions for our server and she was very helpful in explaining portion sizes and that most people order 1.5-2 plates.  A friend and I split 3 plates. The fish tacos were amazing, and I am not even a huge fan of most fish. The fish was cooked and seasoned perfectly and was so light and flaky. The salsa was delicious and the lime sour cream was a great addition.  We also got the pretzel sliders (minus onion).. They were good, I think the onions would have made it better but my friend doesnt like them. The meat didnt really seem seasoned, but it wasnt bad, just pretty good.  We also got the mac & cheese.  This was also pretty good, the pepperjack cheese in it adds a little spice which helped. I also tried their fries which were just standard fries but the chipotle aioli dipping sauce was really good.  Overall, I really enjoyed this place and will definitely go back for a second try.  Again, I was surprised that I enjoyed the fish tacos so much considering I rarely eat any kind of fish.

Reviews.Author: Barry S.
Reviews.Content: Tapas!  Very impressed, Great Service, and even better food!  We went here yesterday for a business meeting, sat on the patio, and had some fun.  Crab cakes, Fries, Shrimp, Filet, Salad, and a few Arnold Palmers.  They can hang with the best.

Reviews.Author: Brian M.
Reviews.Content: grabbed a quick pizza here before heading to the jazz cafe at music hall. fast, friendly service. good pizza.

Reviews.Author: Marty W.
Reviews.Content: I love Small Plates! This is easily one of my favorite restaurants in the city. The food is always amazing (the BBQ pork sliders, crab cakes, and calamari are great) and it comes promptly. Their specialty drinks (like the Gorilla Milk) are pretty damn good too. The staff is always really nice, so the service is on-point as well. It's decently priced and I always feel good about the portion sizes. It's enough to fill you right up, yet you don't get the feeling that you're under-eating either. A very deserving 5 stars!

Reviews.Author: Annemarie F.
Reviews.Content: While the atmosphere is pleasant, the service is mediocre and the food is horrible.  The almond chicken was way too sweet, the lettuce wraps had absolutely no flavor, and the panko shrimp had been left in the deep fryer for too long (besides being topped with a mayo-something that was so heavy I had to scrape most of it off  with my spoon).  With just 3 small plates and 2 drinks our bill was over $60.  And I left hungry!  It was one of the most unenjoyable and overpriced meals I have had in a restaurant in a long time.  I wish I had gone next door and had a burger at Detroit Beer Company.  I suggest you do the same.

Reviews.Author: Steve L.
Reviews.Content: Had dinner b4 the McCartney concert - service was terrible, food was overpriced, no air conditioning.......

Reviews.Author: Neil T.
Reviews.Content: Solid place, especially for the theatre crowd. Eric is a great bartender.  A little pricey but nice.

Reviews.Author: John D.
Reviews.Content: Was at Small Plates recently since it changed ownership. Mac & Four Cheese, Pretzel Sliders and Ahi Tuni are incredible. Service was excellent. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Unknown
Reviews.Content: Fantastic food. Offers a wide variety of dishes and quite a few vegetarian options. Best to be shared with friends. The Empanadas are probably the greatest, in my opinion. The atmosphere is quite nice both inside the restaurant and outside.
